intro: Corymbium glabrum, commonly known as the smooth corymbium, is a flowering plant native to Australia. It belongs to the family Myrtaceae, which includes eucalyptus and tea trees. The plant is characterized by its smooth, glabrous stems and lance-shaped leaves that are usually arranged alternately along the stem. Its small, white or pale pink flowers appear in clusters, typically during the spring and summer months. Corymbium glabrum is often found in woodland and heathland environments, thriving in well-drained soils.
